div.l: She was yfostered in a Nonnerye
For symkyn nolde no wyfe as he seide
But sho were wel y norsshed and a maide
To saven his estate of yomanry
And sho was proud and pert as a pie
A ful feire sighte was it vpon hem two
On halidayes byforn̄ hir wolde he go
With his tipet y wounde a boute is hede
And she cam after in gytdegytegyde of rede
And symkym hedde hosyn of þe same
Ther durst no wight to clepen her but dame
Was non so hardy that went by þe weye
Þat with hir durst rage or ones pley
But yf he wolde be slayen of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or bodekyn
For Ialous folke byn ꝑperelous euer mo
Al gate þey wolde hir wyves wenden so
And eke for she was somdel smoterlych
She was as digne as wat̉er in a diche
So ful of hoker and of bysmare
Hir þought þat a lady shulde hir spare
What for her kynrede and her norterye
Þat she hed lerned in þe Nonnerye
A doghter hedde þey by twyxt he two
Of xx yere withouten eny mo
Savyng a childe of halfe yere age
In cradel hit lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche thikke and wel y growe was
With chamse nose and yen grey as glas
With buttokys brode and brestes rounde and hye
But right feire was hir here y wolnot lye
Þe ꝑperson of þe towne for she was feire
In purpos was to maken hir his eyre
Both of his catel and his mesuage
And straunge he made hit of hir mariage
His purpos was for to bestowe hir hye
Into somme worthi blood of Auncetrye
For holy chirches gode but byn dispended
Of holy chirches blode þat is descended
Þerfore he wolde his holy blod honoure
